body.p: Input power is cabled into the Main Cabinet Input section. The bottom input power cable plate is solid and customers should make their own cutout(s) for cables or conduit. See .

If cable entry is from the top of the unit, input cables must be run behind the Controls Compartment. The entire Controls Compartment must be swung open to run input power cables to the Main Input Circuit Breaker.

fig.title: Input Section: Top and Bottom Cable Entry

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\CURRENT PROJECTS\Work Requests\WR23034 164001124 PARTS PowerPak 2 PDU 100-400 kVA IO manual\P-164001124 PowerPak 2 Power Distribution Unit 100 – 400 kVA Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\11.pdf

body.p:
Each Distribution Output Section has its own ground and neutral output connections. (See .)
Bottom cable exit: ground and neutral busbars are located at the bottom of the section.
Top cable exit: neutral busbar for subfeeds is at top of section; ground busbar is at bottom ofsection.
Panelboard ground and neutral strips are always at the sides of the panelboards.
Distribution Output Section with Subfeeds: Ground and Neutral Busbars
